J.B.,

F=
or some info on WebStart see http://java.sun.com/products/javawebstart/
It'=
s basically a mechanism for downloading Java apps (e.g. Swing apps)
by
clic=
king on a link on a webpage.  The WebStart software on the client
machine
t=
hen fetches the jars (if not previously cached) and runs the program
locall=
y
on the client machine.  Think of it like applets "Next Generation".

To v=
erify our app's are running correctly after a build/deploy cycle,
we need t=
o click the link on a webpage for each app, observe WebStart
download each =
app. without error and observe each (Swing) app. start
correctly (e.g. show=
 it's initial login screen).

Thus there's not much to test on the HTTP sid=
e of things apart from
ensuring each link is valid...
